content.description: An inspiring line if you like crack! I led it with trad gear, but haven't been back to do it as a boulder problem. It's all there, solid rock, and nice jugs so ended up using less crack/OW technique than originally anticipated (either good or bad thing depending on your tastes). Angle mellows out about halfway up, making the top more mellow.Wasn't sure if this has been climbed yet but if someone knows the proper name, please let me know.
content.protection: pads, or cams (#4 was the biggest I placed but there are lots of horizontals that take .5, .75, etc)
content.location: Not sure exactly where this is in relation to the "lower wall" but it is about 10 min from the corridor, keep heading down stream and where the riverbed breaks left, you can't miss this huge buttress on the right.

content.description: Far down the canyon from the Warm-Up Wall and The Corridor is a very nice-looking wall with just a few problems. All are fairly difficult and tend to be sandy from lack of traffic. The Lower Wall proper is on the right side of the canyon and begins with a beautifully featured blunt prow. Another wall across the canyon has a couple ok problems that often have water in the landing.
